plugin_desc: It is used to collect various monitoring index data of Tencent Cloud in real - time, covering dimensions such as computing resources, network performance, and storage usage, helping users gain in - depth insights into resource status, accurately locate anomalies, and efficiently complete operation and maintenance management and cost optimization.

metrics.name: cvm_CPU_Usage
metrics.description: The real-time percentage of CPU occupied during machine operation.

metrics.name: cvm_MemUsed
metrics.description: The actual memory used by the user, excluding memory occupied by buffers and system cache. Calculated as Total Memory - Available Memory (including buffers and cached), which does not include buffers and cached.

metrics.name: cvm_MemUsage
metrics.description: The actual memory utilization rate by the user, excluding memory occupied by buffers and system cache. It is the ratio of actual user memory usage to total memory, excluding cache, buffers, and free memory.

metrics.name: cvm_CvmDiskUsage
metrics.description: The percentage of used disk capacity relative to total capacity (all disks).

metrics.name: cvm_LanOuttraffic
metrics.description: Average outbound traffic per second on the internal network interface card.

metrics.name: cvm_LanIntraffic
metrics.description: Average inbound traffic per second on the internal network interface card.

metrics.name: cvm_LanOutpkg
metrics.description: Average outbound packet rate per second on the internal network interface card.

metrics.name: cvm_LanInpkg
metrics.description: Average inbound packet rate per second on the internal network interface card.

metrics.name: cvm_WanOuttraffic
metrics.description: Average outbound traffic rate per second on the external network. The minimum granularity data is calculated as total traffic over 10 seconds divided by 10. This data represents the sum of outbound/inbound bandwidth from EIP+CLB+CVM on the external network.

metrics.name: cvm_WanIntraffic
metrics.description: Average inbound traffic rate per second on the external network. The minimum granularity data is calculated as total traffic over 10 seconds divided by 10. This data represents the sum of outbound/inbound bandwidth from EIP+CLB+CVM on the external network.

metrics.name: cvm_WanOutpkg
metrics.description: Average outbound packet rate per second on the external network interface card.

metrics.name: cvm_WanInpkg
metrics.description: Average inbound packet rate per second on the external network interface card.
